Summary: This property is close to beach access, and many nice restaurants All around great property,very well managed and maintained. The wonderful breakfast was an added bonus.
Manager Response: Dear Santaynez -  It was wonderful having the opportunity to welcome you. It means a great deal that you found every aspect of the hotel contributed to a comfortable hotel experience. We are so grateful for your recommendation and the time spent to review our hotel. Thank you again, and please consider our hotel when you next visit the area.   Sincerely,  Vince Neale General Manager

Summary: Fun time , great place.  wonderal company, would do it again in a heartbeat
Manager Response: Dear John -  Thank you for your kind review. Any opportunity we have to show a guest that a stay at our hotel can be "great" is much appreciated. Your recommendation is much appreciated and we hope you will visit us again in the future.   Warm regards,   Vince Neale General Manager

Summary: We have stayed at Ayres Laguna Woods many times as well as other Ayres Hotels in Southern California. The staff is always very helpful and caring. The rooms are nice with incredibly comfortable beds as well as the rooms being impeccably clean. They provide a great cooked to order breakfast which is included in the room price. We have always had a great experience at Ayres Hotels.
Manager Response: Dear PaigeB4 -  Thank you so much for choosing our hotel for your stay and for your continued patronage of the Ayres Hotels. We love having the chance to show our guests that a stay at any of the hotels in our collection will be exceptional. I am thrilled you find the accommodations and service of our hotels so consistently comfortable and am pleased the cleanliness of our hotels is always up to standard. We greatly appreciate your recommendation of the Ayres chain of hotels and hope to welcome you again very soon.   Safe travels,  Vince Neale General Manager

Summary: This was my second stay at this location. It is tucked back from a main road so it is quiet. I never heard the other guests on either side of me. The freshly cooked breakfast is so much nicer than just the toast and bagel options at other hotels. The beds are comfortable as well. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I will stay again next time I'm in town.
Manager Response: Dear Skittlebean -  We appreciate you choosing our hotel for a second time. Thank you for giving us a second opportunity to show you that a stay at our hotel can be comfortable and convenient. I am pleased our hotel proved a quiet and pleasant place for your getaway. It is also wonderful to know you found the Ayres Dream Sleeper mattress so comfortable as this custom mattress is the main attraction for many of our guests. Your recommendation is most appreciated and we hope to welcome you back very soon.   Sincerely,  Vince Neale General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice hotel for staying. They make you feel like home.
Summary: It is a good hotel that can be use if you come for business. They have happy hours from monday to thursday and they give beers, pizza and snaks. The pool is small, but nice. The rooms are large, and comfortable. I like its employees; they are always  paying attention to your needs.
Manager Response: Dear Zeji -  Thank you so much for taking the time to review our hotel. We are always thrilled to hear that a guest finds everything from the service to the accommodations welcoming. I am also pleased to know that the items offered during our weekday Manager's Reception were so enticing and lent themselves to a relaxing hotel experience overall. We greatly appreciate your recommendation and hope to welcome you again very soon.   Sincerely,  Vince Neale General Manager

Summary: Lovely rooms in this quiet hotel with great hot breakfast, evening cookies and congenial staff. Located within reasonable drive of Laguna Beach.

We had to book a room at the last minute due to a complicated family emergency.  This hotel is a beautiful property from the lobby to the rooms to the exterior.  There is classical music piped into the elevator. The soundproofing works.  The breakfast included is full service. The staff was really accommodating to our needs which included extending our stay on a day to day basis. The price was a pleasant surprise, too. I recommend this hotel highly.
Manager Response: Dear Margru -  We appreciate you allowing us the opportunity to welcome you to the Ayres Hotel Laguna Woods. I am thrilled to know you found the decor so beautiful and the breakfast so appetizing. We do know that sometimes circumstances provide difficulties to our guests and are always happy to do our utmost to meet any special needs should a guest need to be accommodated in any way. We greatly appreciate your recommendation and hope you will choose our hotel in the future.   Warm regards,   Vince Neale General Manager

Summary: This hotel was first rate.  We got everything we needed at the stay there.  We got a room with partition so the early riser group can stay on one side without disturbing the night owls.  There was a mini fridge and microwave and a small sink in the "kitchen corner".  So on days we got back late to the hotel, we can still have a quick decent snack.  The hot breakfast was great!!!  The staff was very friendly.  The fitness center was well equipped.  The pool was set up so little ones can stay on the shallow side while my older one can swim in the deeper end.  The jacuzzi was bigger then most hotel's.  And the hotel is coveniently located with restaurants and grocery stores super close by.  We couldn't have ask for a better place to stay!!

This was a great surprise.  The pictures looked great and it was great.  When we first drove up the street it led us into a town center, we didn't know what to expect, but as you drove up to the front doors it was great.  All dark wood, tons of art, and the staff was great.  Our room was spacious and lovely.  And there was a free full on breakfast...yum!  It was only a 10 minute drive to the beach and was much better looking than the hotels near the beach.  We like nice hotels and good food...we got both.  Thank you!

I have now stayed here three times, mostly for business travel.  I love it!  I would recommend it to anyone and everyone, especially at the corporate rate.  My only minor criticisms:  Minnie (at the front desk) is not pleasant to deal with by phone; there is no attached restaurant for lunch or dinner; and it is not the best place to stay with small children.  (Bathroom sink and beds are too high up and out of reach, but kleenex box, refrigerator, and microwave are well within reach :) ).  But all the other amenities and friendly staff more than make up for these minor inconveniences.

This is one, if not my most, favorite boutique hotels in O.C.  Staff is probably the best I have ever experienced and the full well-cooked-to-order breakfast is an added benefit.  This last stay, however, they did mess up the reservation and my credit card.  If not for Minnie, this could have really upset our visit.  She is the best.

Very nicely appointed hotel with nice amenities. Wine and snacks at happy hour, fresh baked cookies galore. Very nice ambiance and prompt staff. Hot breakfast in the morning (full breakfast service) with great variety. I stay here every time I come.
This is by far the best, most friendly hotel that I have stayed at in the Orange County area.

Summary Heading: Ayres Hotel Laguna Woods exceeds expectations!
Summary: From the moment I walked into the lobby I knew this was a very special place! Excellent, happy, and helpful staff! Beautiful all the way around and the rooms were excellent! Very clean, comfortable, roomy. Add to that the free breakfast that was fresh and cooked to order! All around, the staff and hotel totally exceeded my expectations! Would definately recommend a visit here and I will stay here on my next trip to the Laguna area.

I LOVE this hotel, every single day they go out of their way to make you feel welcome and appreciated, from a complete complimentary breakfast in the morning to complimentary beer and wine with goodies in the evening, this is a first rate hotel with first rate service, if you want to be treated and made to feel like the special person you are then you must stay at AYRES HOTEL Laguna Woods CA

Summary Heading: Really nice location near Saddleback Church
Summary: A friend and I stayed here for 3 nights for a conference at Saddleback.  The location was quiet and safe.  The hotel was nice.  The beds were comfortable and rooms were clean.  Great breakfast buffet with nice hot service (eggs/omelets made to order).  The staff was very kind and helpful.  Would stay here again - location is not far from John Wayne airport (maybe 15 minutes with no traffic).  We also got a free upgrade at check-in.  Convenient to quite a few restaurants (although we only ate at the hotel and the conference - didn't have time to explore).  Would stay here again if ever in the area.

Everything was beautiful.  The fixtures and carpet and couches and breakfast all seemed a step up from the usual.  But something undefined kept it from an excellent rating . . . maybe it was the variable temperature in the room, the hot water that took a long time to come and then got too hot, or the receptionist who wouldn't help with the simplest of requests.  I'm being picky.  The breakfast cook was super friendly.  The General Manager refilled my coffee and brought me some cream.  It was Very Good, just not excellent.

I had to vacate my condo for a 3-day refurb and decided to spoil myself and stay at the nearby Ayres.  It was a great decision.  The hotel, rooms, bathroom and all public areas were spotless, large and comfortable.  The staff were friendly, helpful, and treated us all like royalty.  They have a free hot breakfast with fresh omelets, made to order, all regular hot breakfast items (bacon, potatoes, eggs, etc) plus do-it-yourself waffles with strawberries. Also are a wide variety of hot and cold cereals, yoghurts, hot and cold beverages, and a both cut and whole fruit.  Their evening happy hour in the lobby (5-7) offers free and unlimited beer, wine, and sodas with either crackers and cheese or chips and salsa for the entire time.  They also have fresh, warm chocolate-chip and

The Ayers hotel is, by far, the best place in the area. The location is terrific, the price is reasonable, and the breakfast is perfect. I have never had a bad experience at this hotel, and would recommended it for everyone from business travelers to families with children.
You make the retreat and stay the best every time.  Thank you for all you provide us and especially for providing Beline each and every time.  She makes us all feel at home and well cared for.
Manager Response: Dear Pdcurtin -  Thank YOU for allowing us the opportunity to welcome you time and again. We strive to make the retreat a comfortable, fun, and inviting event, so it is fantastic to know that we are able to do this for you so consistently. As Belen is an important part of our team, I will be sure to pass along your compliments. We hope to welcome you again very soon.   Warm regards,  Vince Neale General Manager

Summary: Stayed at the Laguna Woods Ayers for five days for a friend's wedding.  The only reason this hotel did not get the fifth star was that the were very stingy with their shuttle.  It basically could only be used to go to the John Wayne airport and back but little else.  Otherwise the hotel was very nice.  It was nice to have a small fridge and microwave in the room.  The complimentary breakfast (limited hours 7-9) included eggs cooked to order, bacon, potatoes, waffles, pancakes plus the usual fruit, breads and cereals.  The complimentary happy hour included red and white wines small snacks, but was only Monday - Thursday.  The wireless was complimentary the speed varied widely throughout our stay.  The rooms were nice, fairly large and fairly nicely furnished.  Nothing
Manager Response: Dear Bruce -  It was a pleasure welcoming you as our guest. Thank you for taking the time to share your experience on TripAdvisor. While I am thrilled you found the accommodations, complimentary full American breakfast, and Manager's Reception conducive to a comfortable stay, I do apologize for any inconvenience caused by our shuttle service. Our limited shuttle service is typically utilized to take guests to the nearest airport (John Wayne) and corporations within a close radius of the hotel. I do apologize for any miscommunication regarding this and will review your comments with our Front Desk team to ensure they are giving guests appropriate information. Thank you again for your review and we hope to welcome you back very soon.   Warm regards,  Vince Neale General Manager

Summary: I just returned from a 5-night stay with my family and we have only wonderful things to say about the hotel and the entire staff. We will absolutely stay here again. We were impressed with the daily complimentary breakfast and happy hour. Alex cooked us delicious fresh egg omelets every morning. The GM even stopped in to say good morning and refill our coffee cups. After sightseeing all day it was great to come back at 5 to a relaxing happy hour. Each night there was a beautiful spread and we would take our goodies out to the pool area and watch the sunset and enjoy the hot tub/pool. Of course, we cannot forget to mention the smell of home made cookies in the lobby at night as well. We looked forward to a warm cookie before bed each night! The beds were comfortable and the rooms
Manager Response: Dear Wende -  Thank you so much for your very kind review of Ayres Hotel Laguna Woods. We appreciate you giving us the opportunity to show you that a stay at an Ayres Hotel can be comfortable and inviting. I am pleased that the service and various amenities offered, including the complimentary full American breakfast and cookies, lent themselves to such an exceptional stay. We are always thrilled to learn we have satisfied a guest so thoroughly as that is our ultimate goal. Your recommendation is much appreciated and we hope to welcome you again very soon.   Many thanks,  Vince Neale General Manager

Summary: I've been staying at the Ayers every week two nights a week for the last six months and have nothing but great things to say about the quality of service and overall accommodation. The breakfast included is wonderful and is served with friendly faces and happy hour in the afternoon is a perfect touch. The staff go above and beyond to ensure a pleasant and comfortable stay and the rooms are very comfortable with new top-of-line mattresses and crisp fresh linens.  I would highly recommend this hotel!!
Manager Response: Dear NNolan -  We appreciate you sharing your experience with fellow travelers. Thank you for your very kind words and for choosing Ayres Hotel Laguna Woods time and again. We understand that exceptional service is of the utmost importance in creating a comfortable and welcoming hotel experience, so I am very pleased that we are able to provide this to you so consistently. Thank you for your continued patronage and we look forward to seeing you again.  Many thanks,  Vince Neale General Manager

Summary: Stayed over the Easter weekend visiting family in 'Leisure World.'  The decor is faux-European, which would make most Europeans hysterical.  But the bed is very comfortable and the room was clean and quiet.  Front desk staff were also competent and pleasant to deal with.  Not so great in the breakfast room on Easter Sunday.  The lady working behind the grill did not want to be there.  When I ordered my breakfast, the response was 'Room number?'.  Then when I went to get a cup of tea while she supposedly cooked my eggs, she forgot the order and moved on to making other people's breakfasts.  When I returned to pick up the eggs, I had to remind her of my order and she demonstrated obvious annoyance that I still wanted breakfast.  She then responded by cooking them poorly - two
Manager Response: Dear Human44 -  Thank you very much for your candid review of our hotel. While I am pleased you found the accommodations comfortable and clean and the service exceptional, I do apologize if our breakfast service was not as desired.   All of our hotels offer a complimentary full American breakfast as we know this meal is important to our guests and necessary to start the day off comfortably. An integral part of this meal is the service that goes along with it. On one of the days mentioned we were short staffed and I apologize if this caused any issue with cleanliness in the breakfast room. Please know that your comments are being taken very seriously and have already been shared with the breakfast team to ensure each guest is treated in a welcoming and warm manner and the cleanliness of the breakfast room is up to our very high standards.   Again I apologize for any inconvenience and hope we will have the chance to welcome you once again.   Regards,  Vince Neale General Manager

Summary: We have been visiting this hotel for years now.  It is absolutely my favorite to stay in when I visit Southern California.  Like everyone says, it is not on the beach but only a few miles away.  The courtyard is very relaxing and beautiful. I love to just sit out there and read and relax. The staff are all wonderful.  The breakfast is top notch.  It is close to freeways, Laguna Beach, and just about anything else you want.  Great restaurants in the area, shopping mall, beach, movies, anything.  Or you can just relax and enjoy the atmosphere.  The decor of the hotel is beautiful.  It is my personal taste which just makes me feel more at home. I cannot wait to return for my usual summer get away and recommend this to anyone visiting the area.
Manager Response: Dear Lovegospa -  Thank you so much for your very kind words and for allowing us the opportunity to provide you with exceptional service time and again. I am so pleased that you find the hotel's ambiance, location, service, and accommodations so consistently comfortable. We do find that many guests find our location pleasing as we are close enough to Laguna Beach and its various offerings without being bogged down by the crowds that populate the area, so thank you for sharing this information with fellow travelers. We greatly appreciate being your choice of hotel when visiting Southern California and look forward to your return this summer.  Warm regards,  Vince Neale General Manager

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel in upscale area near Laguna Beach
Summary: This hotel definitely lived up to the many glowing reviews on TripAdvisor.  Although it is not on the beach, it is in a very upscale community that is convenient to everything in the area.  The lovely decor was like something you would find in a much more expensive resort hotel.  There was always a guest or two lounging comfortably by the fireplace in the lobby or chatting in the gorgeous pool area.  The hot tub was truly hot (and with great jets!), and was a pleasure to enjoy under the full moon in the evening.  Bathrooms had granite counters, the beds were fabulously comfortable, and everything was spotless.  Breakfast is not to be missed with made-to-order omelets and other specialty items.  The chef made the breakfast room feel like a five-star restaurant.  The dignified yet
Manager Response: Dear Sportymom74 -  It was such an honor having you as our guest. Thank you for your very kind words and for sharing your experience at Ayres Hotel Laguna Woods with fellow travelers. Nothing pleases us more than to know we have provided the very best in service and accommodations to our guests, so I am thrilled to hear that your stay with us was so exceptional. I work with a wonderful team of people who take great pride in creating the best possible guest experience and will be sure to share your kind comments with them so they know they are appreciated. A guest recommendation is the highest honor a hotel can achieve so your enthusiastic review is greatly appreciated. We hope to welcome you again soon.   Many thanks,  Vince Neale General Manager

Summary Heading: Hidden secret of a quiet hotel
Summary: Although you don't get the stunning views of the beach.  The staff and amenities are too good to pass up.  A breakfast that is simply the best.  Happy hour that is not to be missed.   I travel for business a lot and their beds are the ones I can count on getting a good night sleep on.   Since this place is kind of hidden, it helps keep the families away.  I like a nice quiet hotel where I don't have screaming kids up and down the hallways.  Or bouncing off the walls in the rooms.   The pool and hot tub are so very clean and nice.  A great seating area in the patio also. You must see the old photos of the streets around that area in their hallway.  And meet new friends at Happy Hour sitting in front of the fireplace.   Don't forget to bring a book to exchange in the seating area.
Manager Response: Dear Kathy -  Thank you for your very kind review and for your continued patronage. What a treat to know that you continually find the accommodations inviting, the location convenient, and the weekday Manager's Reception conducive to discovering new friends and authors. There is nothing more satisfying than knowing a guest has had the best possible stay at our hotel time and again. We appreciate you sharing your positive experience on TripAdvisor and hope to welcome you again very soon.  Warm regards,  Vince Neale General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice hotel.  Will be excellent with a little polish.
Summary: Friendliness of the front desk staff varied from person to person.  I recall Nick and Joy being very courteous and friendly.  They both were very engaged in assuring I had a good experience.  Quality of the breakfast seemed to suffer greatly on Saturday and Sunday.  The impression I got was that breakfast is scaled back on these two days due to the hotel being busier.  If this is the case then I would expect additional staff provided to the breakfast area on these two days, yet instead there were still only two people and they were not as friendly as during the week.  Maid staff seemed to do the absolute minimum during our stay.  We would have utilized the limo service but it seems to be pretty useless.  We were told they require 24 hours advance notice and only go to the mall,

The hotel was very nice.  The staff were always friendly and attentive.  I absolutely loved the variety of items on the breakfast menu.  Everything from cold cereal to omelettes.  The room was just right and I slept like a baby every night. I have to go back for business this summer and will stay here again.

Summary Heading: My favorite hotel in the area
Summary: My corporate HQ office is in Irvine, so I find myself coming to the area several times a year for weekly stays. My hotel of choice is the Ayres on El Toro.   The staff is always friendly and helpful (Nick, Marilyn, Asif) whenever I am checking in or out.  The rooms are very comfortable. On this stay, I was in room 362 which has a king size bed along with a couch. There is a microwave and small fridge. There is a sink area outside the bathroom. There is plenty of walking space in the room even with a work desk, coffee table, and another small table with two chairs.  The rooms are very quiet as well. On this stay, there was a family across the hall with a little baby. I could hear crying when I was in the hallway, but nothing when I entered my room and closed the door.  There are

I stayed here for three weeks.  The rooms are very nice.  The staff was very friendly and attentive.  The hot breakfast is a plus, very complete with omelettes, fresh fruit, sweets, coffee, juices, etc.  The sweet smell of freshly made cookies annonced the evening reception from Monday thru Thursday.  The location of the hotel is perfect.  Close to the malls, nice restaurants, some even at walking distance and just about 10 mins to Laguna Beach.  I could not resist the swimming pool and the jacuzzi either.  I definately will stay again here with my family or work next time.
Manager Response: Dear Salma37 -  Thank you very much for allowing us to host you for your extended stay in the area. It is wonderful to hear that you found everything from the accommodations to the location to the complimentary full American breakfast satisfying and that your overall stay was a comfortable one. Nothing pleases us more that to know we have provided the best possible hotel experience for our guests. Thank you again.  Sincerely,  Vince Neal  General Manager

Summary Heading: Wonderful stay at a great price
Summary: Everything was excellent, from the pleasant receptionists, to the room, to the scrumptuous breakfast.  If you need a place to stay around Orange County, look no further and stay here.
Manager Response: Dear AfrTraveler -  Thank you for your very kind review and for choosing our hotel for your stay. I am pleased that we were able to make such a strong and exceptional impression with our service and various amenities. We take great pride in providing the best possible hotel experience for our guests, so it is wonderful to know that our efforts are appreciated. I will be sure to share your comments with the rest of the team here at Ayres Hotel Laguna Woods.  Sincerely,  Vince Neale  General Manager

Summary: Sometimes stay here when working at our corporate office. This is the third time I have stayed, normally for 6 days at a time. Staff are always very nice and always have time to talk to you. The hotel is always nice and clean and very well presented. The pool looks very inviting but haven't had a swim as it's a little chilly when we stay in January. The wireless internet is always working and is very fast. A real bonus when working away from home. The gym is a little small though and you have to be lucky to get in at certain times. Early afternoon is always a good time though. The managers reception in the early afternoon (Mon-Thur) is always a good time to chat over a beer and snacks. The breakfast choice is first class and the manager comes around with coffee in the morning
Manager Response: Dear GavinBridger -  It was an honor having you as our guest. Thank you for sharing your experience on TripAdvisor and for your continued patronage. Nothing is more satisfying than knowing we have provided the best possible hotel stay for our guests, so it is wonderful to hear that service and amenities are consistently comfortable. As stated with our previous reviewer, our fitness room is going through an expansion that should be completed in the next month. This should allow more guests to utilize the room at once. We look forward to your next visit.  Safe travels,  Vince Neale General Manager

Summary: My company has us stay here when visiting the home office. Very nice rooms, helpful friendly staff. Great free breakfast, made to order omelets most mornings. Evening reception Monday - Thursdays. Dining and shopping nearby. Only downside I have found is the workout room is very small and all the equipment is in use if you don't get down there by 6 am.
Manager Response: Dear CPatchlii -  Thank you very much for taking the time to share your experience on TripAdvisor and for staying with us. The breakfast team works very hard each morning to ensure guests have a delicious meal, so it is wonderful to know that their efforts are appreciated and I will be sure to share your comments with them. As to the fitness room, you will be happy to learn that we are currently working on an expansion that will bring three new pieces of cardio equipment to the fitness room as well as various mats and medicine balls. This project should be completed in the next month. Hopefully on your next visit you will have the chance to try out the new fitness equipment.   Warm regards,  Vince Neale General Manager

Summary: We stayed here over a weekend recently because it was convenient to the memorial service we were attending, and due to the positive reviews.  We also got a great weekend rate.  We were very pleasantly surprised by the size and comfort of the rooms, the attractive furnishings and the amenities. We had a third-floor double queen room, while my brother had even more spacious king room.The beds were great and we slept well. No problems with the heating & ventilation. The reception desk was very helpful, particularly when I had trouble printing out our airline boarding passes on the lobby computer. Parking was convenient and afforded quick access to the nearest elevator. The breakfast is one of the very best we've had in a hotel--they must really be busy during the business week!
Manager Response: Dear Escargo1-  Thank you very much for taking the time to let fellow travelers know about our hotel. I am so pleased you chose us for your stay and that the room and amenities, such as the complimentary full American breakfast, made for a convenient and enjoyable experience. I work with a wonderful group of people who take great pride in providing the very best for our guests, so I will be sure to share your experience with them. Thank you again. We look forward to your next visit.  Safe travels,  Vince Neale General Manager

Summary Heading: Would stay there again in a heartbeat!!
Summary: We were delighted with our room, the comfy kingsize bed, great pillows, lovely decor. Enjoyed breakfast each morning, the friendly staff and the temptation of freshly baked cookies each evening!
Manager Response: Dear Cheryl -  Thank you so much for choosing Ayres Hotel Laguna Woods for your stay. I am glad to know that we were able to provide you with a comfortable and convenient hotel visit. We strive exceedingly hard to ensure we provide the best possible accommodations and service for our guests, so I am happy your experience was such a positive one. I hope we will have the chance to welcome you back very soon.  Warm regards,  Vince Neale General Manager

Summary: I really enjoyed my stay at the Ayres Hotel Laguna Woods. The staff was really helpful and I really enjoyed my stay.
Manager Response: Dear Efram b -  Thank you so much for taking the time to let fellow travelers know about our hotel and your positive experience. I am thrilled we were able to provide you with service that made for a comfortable and convenient stay. I have the pleasure of working with a wonderful team who truly take the guest experience very seriously, so I will be sure to pass along your compliments. We hope to host you again very soon.   Sincerely,  Vince Neale General Manager

Summary: Spacious room, very clean with a comfortable bed.  We stayed 6 nights and took advantage of the made-to-order morning breakfast and the evening happy hour, especially the chocolate chip cookies.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  The location was perfect, close to everything in Laguna Beach and Costa Mesa. The wifi worked well in the lobby and ok in the room.  The free parking was huge savings.  The cleaning staff were great, we always came back to a very spotless room at the end of the day.  We look forward to a return visit.
Manager Response: Dear Flemshawn -  Thank you so much for choosing Ayres Hotel Laguna Woods for your stay and for taking the time to share your positive experience. It is always a pleasure to hear that the amenities, such as complimentary WiFi and parking, have made a guest's stay with us comfortable. I am also happy to know we provided you with the cleanest possible room as we hold our hotel and all Ayres Hotels to a very high standard of cleanliness. We hope to welcome you again very soon.  Safe travels,  Vince Neale General Manager

Summary Heading: Love it, love it, love it!!!
Summary: I've stayed here several times and it never disappoints.  Great service, atmosphere, food and comfort.
Manager Response: Dear Genevax -  Thank you so much for allowing us to host your stay again. I am thrilled to know that the accommodations and service provided at Ayres Hotel Laguna Woods make each of your stays with us comfortable. We are always happy to accommodate guest requests for specific rooms when available, so please do not hesitate to ask for a room you would prefer on your next visit. We look forward to your return.  Warm regards,  Vince Neale General Manager

Summary: I recently booked a block of rooms for my daughters' wedding (@ Tivoli Terrace).  I believe we had between 10 and 12 rooms for our family & friends and, I must say, Alicia in the Sales Office was very helpful in setting up our block.    I have heard nothing but praise for the accommodations, service, attention to detail, cleanliness and friendliness of staff.  One of the staff in particular, Kelsey (resembles Natalie Portman - features & voice), was very helpful and attended to any of our requests, promptly.    The beds were very comfortable, the rooms were exceptionally nice...comfortable, elegant, classy...  One family member stated "we did have the breakfast and it was delicious, the hotel and rooms were clean, very comfortable, the beds were great and would stay again".
Manager Response: Dear Kelly -  Thank you so much for choosing Ayres Hotel Laguna Woods for your accommodations during such a special event. It was an honor having you and your family as guests of the hotel, and I am so pleased we were able to make your stay so comfortable during what can be a whirlwind event. I am privileged enough to work with an amazing group of people who love their jobs, so I will be sure to pass along your compliments to Kelsey and Alicia as well. Again, thank you for your review. We hope you will choose the Ayres Hotels again in the future.   Warm regards,  Vince Neale General Manager

Summary: This was by far the best hotel I have ever stayed at.  The staff was friendly and great! Very accommodating.  I don't usually have to stay at a hotel when I come to California, but if there is ever a time, I will stay here again.  We were here for a wedding with lots of friends and family and everyone had a good stay.
Manager Response: Dear Debi -  It was a pleasure having you as our guest. We greatly appreciate you taking the time to share your experience and your kind compliments. Being told we are the best hotel ever is such a treat for my team as they take great pride in making sure our guests have the most comfortable stay possible. I will be sure to share your remarks with them so they know they are appreciated. We hope to welcome you again very soon.  Safe travels,  Vince Neale General Manager

Summary: We love this hotel and have been coming for many years. The staff is unfailingly friendly, helpful, and welcoming. The rooms and beds are wonderfully comfortable and I love the fact they have refrigerators in the rooms! We enjoy watching the hummingbirds swim in and drink from the beautiful fountain in the courtyard as we eat their delicious breakfast outside in the courtyard. The hotel is conveniently located for us, for everywhere we go in the area. I couldn't imagine staying anywhere else -- seriously, it's our home away from home.
Manager Response: Dear Martha -  Thank you so much for informing fellow travelers about our hotel and for your continued patronage. I am so pleased that the accommodations, amenities, service and complimentary breakfast consistently allow you a relaxing stay. What a treat to know that we are viewed as a comfortable haven for you during your travels. Please know that we appreciate every visit. We look forward to welcoming you again very soon.  Warm regards,  Vince Neale General Manager

Summary: This was a wonderful hotel.  The attention to detail showed throughout the hotel.  The fantastic breakfast, gracious and helpful staff, and the cleanliness throughout the hotel.  If I am ever in the area again, this hotel will be my first choice.    Thank you.
Manager Response: Dear Barbara M -  Thank you so much for your kind review. It is always a pleasure to hear that we have made a guest's stay a comfortable one. The team I am fortunate enough to work with takes great pride in their work, so I will be sure to pass along your comments. Hopefully you will visit the area soon so we will have a chance to welcome you again.   Safe travels,  Vince Neale General Manager

Summary: We have been coming here for many years and wouldn't consider staying anywhere else. From the General Manager to the housekeeping staff, the staff at the Ayres is simply wonderful: warm, efficient, and always welcoming. The rooms are spacious and well-appointed, internet is free, and the breakfasts are generous and satisfying.  The Monday-Thursday 'cocktail hour' is a bonus.  The hotel is well-situated to the highway and to shopping and only about 20 minutes to the beach.  We love it!
Manager Response: Dear Anne C -  It is such an honor to have you as our guest time and time again. Thank you so much for taking the time to let fellow travelers know of our hotel. I am thrilled that you repeatedly find the accommodations, complimentary breakfast, and other amenities to your liking as our goal is and always will be guest comfort. I am fortunate enough to have a wonderful team at the hotel to work with and will pass along your comments. Again, thank you for your review. We look forward to welcoming you again soon.  Regards,  Vince Neale General Manager

Summary: I have stayed at other Hotels and this one is the best  becaue the people were very nice . I could see that they were very willing to help with any thing we needed  also I could see that they have great pride in where they work . yes the breakfast was very good and the happy hour and cookies was great  I hope they do not change because I plain to go back again.
Manager Response: Dear William W -  Thank you so much for your review of Ayres Hotel Laguna Woods. Your description of the hotel and team is humbly appreciated. We do try to make every effort to ensure guest comfort so it is always wonderful to hear that a guest has had a satisfactory stay and plans to return. We hope to host you again very soon.  Sincerely,  Vince Neale General Manager

Summary: In town for business. Ask for a room with a view of the court yard and mountains.

Everything about this hotel was perfection!  This was our first stay as we were visiting family in the area.  The buffet breakfast each morning was as good as it gets.  The decor beautiful and interesting, beds comfy, great location.  Near freeway, but not near enough to get freeway noise.
Manager Response: Dear JOregon_11 -  Thank you so much for your review of Ayres Hotel Laguna Woods. It was such a pleasure welcoming you as our guest, and I appreciate the kind comments regarding our breakfast, decor and location. Perhaps during your next stay you will have the opportunity to visit Laguna Beach, which is only a very short drive away. We hope to welcome you again in the near future.  Safe travels,  Vince Neale General Manager

Summary: I have been staying here for years.. very consistent product... extremely friendly staff rarely changes over the years which should tell you something!!  free drinks at happy hour in the lobby after a long day in the office, fresh baked cookies at night and a hearty buffet breakfast each morning to get your engines running.. home-away-from-home feel.. The rooms are spacious and beds are comfy. great value for money in Irvine Spectrum area.
Everything was perfect.   We recommend Ayres properties to everyone.  Vince Neal and staff are very dedicated to the Ayres business philosophy.

Stay here at least 6 or more times per year for business.  Always perfect in every way.  Staff is super friendly and willing to do what ever it takes to keep us comfortable.  Only thing missing is a full service restaurant, though their cook-to-order exceptional breakfast is the best and can keep you full for most of the day.  Thanks for a great place to stay.

Summary Heading: Looking forward to my return stay
Summary: I travel for business to So. Ca 4 times a year and always book my stays at the Laguna Woods Ayres Hotel.  The staff is exceptionally friendly, the rooms are large and have a microwave & frig in case you have left overs you want to re-heat later.  The rooms are clean and the towels and linens are fresh.  I like to start my day with a good breakfast and they offer a nice selection of both cold and hot items, including made to order option for eggs and omlets.  The pool and hot tub area is a nice option if you have the time. The work out room is small, but they do offer both equipment (treadmills, eliptical and bike) a Universal machine and free weights.  They also offer a nice 5-7 pm managers "special" where you can have a drink or light snack before going out for dinner.  Vince

I've stayed at this particular Ayres Hotel 3 times for company meetings over the last 12 month period and I would highly recommend them.  Rooms and linens were clean, good breakfast, easy parking, and an excellent staff that will accomodate you.  I would not hesitate to stay with them again and I have provided very positive feedback to our corporate events coordinator to use their services in the future.

Chose Laguna Ayres for wedding guests and ourselves to stay at while in CA. Great choice. Friendly, accommodating, going well beyond the call. Everything about the stay went well and no negatives heard from any of our guests. Thanks Ayres!

My stay at Ayres Hotel was outstanding. When I arrived at the airport, the shuttle was there as I walked outside, ready to take me to Brandman University. I was exceptionaly satisfied with the shuttle service to school and returning to the hotel, the breakfasts were delicious with a great variety of foods, and the evening happy hour was an added bonus. Plus there was a hotel special at the time and I received a great rate. The lobby was available for use and the staff was friendly and welcoming. Thank-you for making my stay as pleasent as possible.

I have stayed at this Ayres hotel several times and been pleased on every occasion.  This time we received an upgrade while paying the lowest rate. Previously I stayed with a handicapped relative and the staff went out of their way to accommodate her needs. The staff is friendly, the facility clean and comfortable and welcoming.

Our stay at the Ayres Hotel was exceptional. The rooms are clean, comfortable with a quiet  touch of luxury combined with a homey feel to it. The staff is friendly, courteous, attentive  and very professional. Breakfast are full and delightful ,there is a Happy Hour Monday to Thursday from 5 to 7pm and the location of the Hotel is excellent. Would not think of staying anywhere else.  Neil C
We loved our stay at the Ayers Hotel in Laguna Woods. Incredibly helpful and friendly staff, amazing decor, rooms luxuriously comfortable and clean - and the breakfasts were were a cullinary delight.

Summary Heading: Decor a bit much but overall great value
Summary: Clean, comfortable, great amenties but the decor is a tad over the top.  All the wood & country home feel were a bit much for me.
I stayed at the Ayres this week and found it to be a comfortable, homey place.  Happy hour from 5-7 was a nice treat with a selection of wines and beer, plus cheese, crackers, fruit and cookies.

This hotel is nice and kid friendly.  The breakfast is very good, and it's really food not just pastries and juice.  The rooms are nice, and clean.  I enjoyed my stay, and will definitely stay in this hotel again.

I wasn't expecting much but was really impressed, especially for the price.  The room was great, staff really friendly and helpful.  I was really  happy and even  joined the Stash Hotel Rewards program the night of my stay hoping to find the same quality and value on visits to other areas.

The front desk was very rude and condescending.  We were there with a wedding that booked something like 25 rooms and they placed an elderly man right in the middle of the room block who complained at 9pm.  The front desk agent threatened to call the police on aunts and uncles even grandparents talking in the room.  Not a smart staff at all!!!
Manager Response: Dear Winston Wedding -  Thank you very much for your candid review of Ayres Hotel Laguna Woods. I am very sorry that your stay with us was unsatisfactory.  Whenever we have a wedding we do our best to ensure that the wedding party stays in close proximity to one another, both for logistical and celebratory reasons. At this time, we already had an elderly long term guest using a room in this particular block. We try very hard to respect the needs of all of our guests to ensure they will have a comfortable stay, and this guest was looking for rest at this hour. We tried to accommodate him by attempting to lower the noise level of the hotel and surrounding rooms several to no avail. I am very sorry for any issues this may have caused you or the wedding party as I know this was a special event.  In the future, please know that we have ample banquet space available for these types of occasions, which would allow for a celebratory gathering without worry of what is happening in the remainder of the hotel. Again thank you for your review and I hope you will consider staying with Ayres Hotel Laguna Woods again.  Vince Neale  General Manager Ayres Hotel Laguna Woods

Summary: We stay on the third floor away from the pool. Nice and quiet.  The only reason we did not give fives across the board is because it would have been nice to have a balcony or to be able to open a window and enjoy the beautiful California weather and because the breakfast (which is free and good) was crowded with inadequate staff to  cook, stock and clear the tables on ONE of the mornings. We stay here often. It is convenient to the highways and Laguna Beach. Free Internet, breakfast, morning paper and warm cookies waiting in the lobby at night.  A GREAT value for the money.
Good price, big room, good breakfast, convenient location.  Really a five-star rating for its class.... .

My family and I stayed here for my daughters wedding that was about a mile away. Hotel staff was friendly, it was a beautiful hotel, very clean and we would definetely stay here again. Beds were very comfortable and staff were very efficient. Absolutely recommend!!

Summary Heading: Great location, clean and comfortable rooms, friendly service.
Summary: This hotel was ronseful for our needs. It's is clean and the rooms are large. We loved having the small refrigerator on the room. Excellent service, and we enjoyed the breakfast that is included. Also loved the cookies and wine in the evening! Lobby is cozy and inviting.

Staff are wonderful:  superior service skills here, friendly AND professional, well-spoken with a positive demeanor, helpful, knowledgeable, humorous if appropriate and overall Nice People.  The enviroment is elegant and fireside lounge always welcoming.  Great jacuzzi and patio fireplace as well, the FULL breakfast is prepared as you like it.

this is an excellent hotel to frequent.. I stay at the Ayres hotel in Laguna Woods often. I want to invite anyone to enjoy this hospitality from the front desk to the housekeepers and maintenance men.The people in the dining room for breakfast are great and very cordial. I give the front desk service five star rating in all aspects of delivering... I travel all over the country as an author and public speaker this hotel is second to none.... thank you.

I stay at the Laguna Woods Ayres frequently because my business is far from my home. I stay once a week on average and feel quite at home when I do. The staff is very friendly and helpful and always try to give me the room I request when I stay. They always have fresh baked cookies and the breakfast is good. If you don't like the usual scrambled eggs you can simply ask the cook to make them to order. The rooms are the usual Ayres style which is warm and welcoming and have that boutique hotel feel. Beds are comfortable, bathrooms are clean and there are a few rooms with jacuzzi tubs which can be a plus. Internet is adequate but can be a bit slow at times. The pool area is clean and the Jacuzzi is always warm. This hotel is located in a very nice clean safe city and I never feel

Summary Heading: European Ambiance, Excellence in Atmosphere and Service
Summary: What a wonderful get away.  The Ayres as in the past has exceeded our expectation. We had stayed her for my Nephews wedding 8 years ago and the hotel was even better this time, well cared for, atmosphere was like a getaway to the Amalfi Coast or Tuscany.  Loved it! Thank you to all the management and staff for a creating a wonderful luxurious retreat in the middle of our busy lives.

I was in a business trip and brought my family.This hotel has a great location, plenty of places to eat, pharmacy across the street, etc. The hotel looks and feels like an upscale hotel, but with an afordable rate. I am very pick with the cleanliness of places where I stay, and this one, achieve my expectations. Very good free breakfast, cookies in the afternoon, free internet in room, plenty of parking spaces. Great value and experience!!

The hotel was very nice and affordable. The rooms are spacious and clean. The bed was very comfortable. The staff was helpful and very friendly, including maintenance staff. I was very impressed with the variety of items offered for breakfast. Don't forget to have a fresh baked cookie at 5:00 pm. I will definitely return.

Summary Heading: This is a $200 or $300 room in another location
Summary: We stay here frequently while visiting family nearby and each time say--wow what a value.The rooms are spacious, textiles are fine, duck feather pillows, free breakfast, and hot cookies at the check-in desk. Buy it with hotels.com or get a nice discount from the front desk over the phone. A few miles away on the coast the rooms are much more expensive and smaller.

We had a family reunion here last week and thanks to the staff and facility it went perfectly. If you have a family member living in Leisure World this is a perfect choice. We had rooms on the ground floor (not something I normally like) which made it very relaxing to go back and forth to the pool and the patio as well as let the small children play outdoors. I ordered a sandwich tray from Jersey Mikes, picked up some drinks at Stater brothers and had a lovely day with 12 guests and my mother as the guest of honor. The hotel staff had no problem with our party and allowed us to store some food in the kitchen since there was room. The staff at the Ayres hotel is awesome!   The first night of our stay we were tired and hungry. We came down for a glass of wine at happy hour and

This hotel is very clean & very comfortable.  Staff is excellent and very willing to help. Not a lot going on here at the hotel, but I think it is mainly a business hotel, so that's ok. Stayed there for a wedding and all the guests seemed very happy with the accommadations. Only drawback I could think of is that there are no views or balconies.

This hotel is next to Highway 5.  A 15 minutes car ride to the beach, where parking is nearly impossible.  A few parking lots along the way with shuttle buses can take you to the sea.   The hotel itself is well maintained.  The room is nice, breakfast is decent, staff is good.  Overall, a good value but beware of the location if your intention is to spend most of your time at the beach.

The Ayres is a European style hotel.  The rooms are wonderful, the staff is attentive and helpful, the complimentary breakfast was delicious.  To top it all off, there are warm cookies available in the afternoon.  You can eat in the delightful patio atmosphere.  There were five friends traveling together and we all loved the hotel.  Easy access to Laguna Beach.  What more coul you want.

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel but needing a bit of a redo
Summary: We have stayed here twice over the past three years. This last time (July 2011) we still enjoyed the stay, but the hotel is beginning to need to be refreshed. The major plusses: very clean, large rooms and excellent breakfast. Negatives: some rooms have awful views, pricey because of this, and there are sometimes mobs of families with many kids (often not well controlled).

My wife and I stayed for two nights at Ayres hotel in Laguna Woods.  It is comparatively more expensive than other hotels in the area, but we enjoyed the many extras such as opulently-framed paintings on the walls, chairs and tables in the halls, and a 5-7 p.m. "happy hour" with all-you-can-eat beer, wine, soft drinks, cookies, and cheese/fruits. On one evening they provided cookies and different kinds of pizza.  Penny-wise expense account travelers could save all of their per diem allowance by eating a lot at breakfast and a lot at the happy hour.   The hotel is at the center of a lovely palm tree-lined mini-shopping complex off of El Toro Road, the main artery in the area.  The Sushi Wok in the same complex provides tasty sushi that is not too heavy after the "happy hour."  We

Thank you very much for the wonderful stay we had again at Ayres. The room was perfect, housekeeping immaculate, and breakfast was good. All staff was courteous and friendly. Being in the hotel business myself,  I recognize good service and good value, and this hotel ranks very high on both. Thank you again..
very clean, great beds, free parking, free internet (wifi), free breakfast, friendly staff...what more could you ask for...

Summary Heading: My new home away from home
Summary: I chose this hotel based on location as I have family in Leisure World. It doesn't hurt that it's just 5 miles from one of the most beautiful beaches in Southern California - Laguna Beach. You might turn away from this hotel because you think it's an average hotel chain  - but it's not. It is the most relaxing hotel I think I have ever stayed in. My room and throughout the hotel were spotless. The bed was extremely comfortable.  Breakfast was delicious. A microwave and frig were great to have if needed. The free shuttle was much appreciated. Minnie, Marilyn, Nick and Chris were personal and attentive to all of my requests. I have tried an upscale hotel nearby in the past and even a lovely hotel on the beach but I am going to be staying at the Ayres from now on.

I stayed just 2 nights while visiting relatives in the retirement home just around the corner. The hotel was booked for me by a cousin who has stayed there, so I really had no idea of what it was like. Apart from a not very friendly receptionist on my arrival, I found it to be a very good hotel. the other staff were pleasant and helpful. The room was very large, fitted with a mini kitchen, comfortable sofa, huge TV, radio and well planned bathroom. It looked onto the swimming pool and mountains beyond. Being February, it was too cold to use the pool, but it looked inviting. There was a vast choice of  things to choose from at breakfast, including really good fresh fuit salads. Definitely a hotel I would return to .

Summary Heading: Nice Choice if you need to stay in the area.
Summary: I was staying at this hotel for four nights while in town for a seminar. I usually choose to stay with Hilton brands, but did not have a choice of this hotel. I arrived around 10:30am and they picked me up at the airport, but even though the driver was at the airport, we had to wait another 45 minutes for others to arrive. The driver was very friendly and the front desk checked me in early.   The hotel appears to be reltively new and is very welcoming. The hotel is off the main road a bit so I did not experience any traffic noise even though our room faced the road.  On first entering the lobby, there is a very welcome feel with a small sitting area. The breakfast area doors are left open during off hours. They have a multitude of fresh baked cookies each afternoon, as well as a

Summary Heading: Beautiful luxury hotel, free parking, includes full breakfast, helpful staff, great location
Summary: Laguna Woods is 20 minutes from Laguna Beach and the value at Ayres Hotel can't be beat.  This beautifful hotel has rooms discounted on the weekends and the weekday rates are very good as well.  They have a pool area with a fire pit which is great for sharing a bottle of wine and snacks with family in the evening and the free  full breakfast was much appreciated.  Parking is free and they have complementary wine and snacks at 5:00 p.m.  If you can't afford to stay right on the beach, this is a great alternative at an affordable price.  Laguna Beach is one of the nicest beaches in the world,surrounded by an art community and wonderful restaurants.

I always stay here where I have business in Irvine.   Its location is great for Irvine or nearby Laguna Beach.  Across the street are a Rite Aid, a supermarket, and a Starbucks.  In the same parking lot are a Sushi Restaurant and a Home Town Buffet.  They have a hot breakfast buffet and a happy hour selections of wine, beer, crackers, and cheese.

I was attending a business function at El Toro Airport with colleagues.  Ayres was our assigned hotel.  Very nice location, rooms nicely appointed.  I was assigned to the 3rd floor facing the courtyard/pool area - nice.  Walls are a little thin, but the A/C helped drown the noise out.  - Beds - nice' n comfy with plenty of pillows - Flat screen TV w/HBO and HBO Family - No snacks available in room, although water is at $4.00 each. - Refr and micro - Bathroom    - Hair conditioner not provided   - Shower caps not provided   - Plenty of towels (thick, but a little on the rough side)   - Happy hour includes wine, beer, sodas, chips and salsa   - Cookies - fresh and warm (chocolate chip and sugar...Mmm, Mmm. - Lobby seating area - Breakfast is pretty decent    -  Oatmeal - Choice of

Summary Heading: Comfortable and friendly little spot, slightly forced decor
Summary: I wanted  a room to rest and relax at before seeing Aerosmith @ Verizon Wireless Amphitheatre, which is just a couple miles away, and this place was ideal. It's far enough from the freeway to be nice and quiet, set back from the street it's on. It's very nicely decorated, maybe just a bit overstated (dripping with artwork), but very friendly and welcoming, sophisticated compared to a plastic Best Western type of hotel. It was VERY clean, it looked clean, it smelled clean. The room had a bar-type sink, a microwave, a small refrigerator, DSL connection, a cleaver alarm clock WITH an iPod adapter (I was impressed and my teenage son was quite pleased), a huge television, et cetera. A small marble table (!) was ideal for playing cards with my daughter after we'd taken a swim in the

Made reservations online; site said Ayres is pet-friendly. Checked in and were directed to side door for entrance. Big sign says: No Pets. So we scrambled to find a place to kennel our registered herding stock border collie. She was boarded for 2 nights when they called us and said she was extremely agitated and we should get her. Natural for a dog who's never been kenneled and is used to the outdoors. I  told the clerk as their website had said pet friendly I was bringing her in. She indicated there was a problem with the co. which runs the site, "That'll be $125 (more than the room)." No so; we brought our dog in. Other than that, rooms are clean,but noisy from overhead. Breakfast excellent. Don't try to sit on patio, that's where the smokers congregate. Ugh. Housekeeping

Summary Heading: A serene space in a busy world.  Exceptional Service
Summary: We were invited to a wedding in Laguna Beach and the bride recommended this hotel as a place to stay.  We were delighted with her choice.  It is a lovely "old world" ambiance within the hotel and a lovely piazza outdoors to enjoy.  There is a sumptuous breakfast included every morning and an evening wine and cheese event.  It felt like you were being nurtured. The location is great.  It is in the middle of Orange County CA. where is can be hectic and confusing in traffic especially when you are from out of town.  It was walking distance from many services and located centrally with easy access to many of the attractions of Orange County like the beaches and the shopping. We enjoyed our stay and would happily recommend this hotel.

Summary Heading: Wonderful european experience near Laguna Beach
Summary: As a member of the hospitality industry, I feel confident having my parents stay at the Ayres. I know that the rooms are nice, the service will be friendly and most importantly that they will be happy (they are repeat customers).  Plus, I can join them in the evening for FREE snacks and wine.  And they fully enjoy starting their day with FREE breakfast.  I know that they will be staying at the Ayres for many years to come.

For the price, the place can’t be beat! My husband said it was the best hotel we’ve stayed at, even though we’ve stayed at a 5 star hotel before! We liked the breakfast in the morning--remember to tip the cook! Just remember that breakfast on weekdays stops at 9 a.m. and on weekends, it stops at 10 a.m. They’re serious--they clear away everything on the dot! Both of us liked the decor in the room--we liked the reproduction paintings on the wall in the room and in the halls. The bathroom was not huge but it was nice and new and clean. The countertop of the sink looked like it was made of marble. Even the decor in the elevator was nice (wood paneling). We worked out in the small but nice gym too. Be aware that some rooms face inward towards the courtyard/ pool and some rooms face
The hotel was very clean and nice, however there were ants in the bedroom. The breakfast was terrific, eggs, sausage, waffle maker, cereal, fruit, juice. That really made the stay.

Summary Heading: Wonderful hotel & and even better staff!!!
Summary: My travel group stayed at the Ayres Hotel in Laguna Woods in August 2009 and I can not express how happy they were with this hotel selection.  One of my elderly travelers had a minor emergency while at the hotel and the GM personally coordinated a trip to urgent care, stayed there throughout treatment and rented a wheelchair for the individual and paid for it himself.  I book many hotels throughout North America and this is certainly some of the best service I've ever experienced! I recommend this hotel for any occasion and I've booked my group here at the Ayres for 2010 as well.  Keep up the great work and we'll see you in 2010!

My sister lives near here, so I am often looking for a good place to stay in the area.  We have stayed here twice (July 2008, July 2009) for 5 and 6 nights.  The experience was very good both times.  The hotel is nice and well-decorated.  The rooms are large (large enough for a family of four) and well appointed.  The breakfast is very good.  The service I have received has been first-rate.  I find the value to be amazing.  Overall I think they do a great job providing as much as they do for the price -- a large room, a microwave and fridge, a great breakfast, a nice pool, even free wireless Internet (I have paid as much as $20 a day for this elsewhere). This last time I opted for the more upscale partitioned room -- one half for us, one half for the kids -- and this afforded a

Summary Heading: Absolutely Terrible Customer Service - Bait and Switch
Summary: I reserved a block of hotel rooms for my wedding guests. They told me they would hold the rooms until 3 weeks prior and release any unbooked rooms into inventory. Two months before my wedding I got a calling telling me that another group wanted to book the same dates and were giving me my 48 hour notice to put a credit card down else give the rooms to someone else.   They NEVER mentioned any time we talked to them anything about this little clause. The first time I heard about the 48 hour notice was when they called me two months out.   The woman on the phone was absolutely unapologetic and just kept asking me whether or not I wanted to put down a credit card. Ugh, I would never recommend them again.

This a wonderful, clean hotel.  I am sure great for a business hotel although we stayed here on our trip to the pageant of the masters in Laguna Beach.  Our first night however we were put in what we were told was a quite room on the top floor.  What they neglected to tell us is that it is adjacent to a room converted to an engineering office and also a housekeeping room.  Needless to say from 7AM on we heard the door open and shut several times and the clanking of dirty dishes coming through.  not a good way to try and sleep in while on vacation.  We asked to be moved.  "Minnie" at the front desk argued with me level of noise, which I did not appreciate, but then succumbed to my requests and gave us another room, which was very nice and quite!  Over all a good hotel!

Summary Heading: Worst customer service I have ever had
Summary: While the hotel was in a perfect location for me, I was treated poorly by the staff from my first call to make a reservation. I had to change rooms due the noise from rooms below me. I was unable to get the front desk and had to use the 800 number to get someone to answer during this racket. Had to move to a far less attractive room with no help. Had numerous very rude, dismissive and unhelpful dealing with the front desk. I can not  recommend this hotel to anyone after my experience there.
Village Church of Irvine held their Women's Retreat here and it was perfect.  Beautiful hotel, great breakfast and the staff was absolutely amazingly helpful.  We will be back!!

Summary Heading: Huge Rooms, Beautifully Decorated, Surprisingly Nice
Summary: We stayed at the Ayers because we had friends getting married nearby and they booked a block of rooms there.  We were honestly shocked at how nice it was considering the really good price we got.  The room was enormous.  The entire place is decorated lushly in a European theme, with pretty art, nice wallpaper etc.  The room had a mini-fridge and microwave, which I always appreciate.  The bedding was extremely comfortable.  The location is fine- very suburban and in a shopping area.  The outside doesn't look like anything special, but the rooms were great.  The staff wasn't terribly friendly.  The private breakfast the wedding party had was delicious.    I'd highly recommend the hotel.  For the price, the room was awesome.

This is a medium aged property in suburban Orange County. I spent three nights there while attending a business conference. The Ayers hotels are a small and, I think, privately owned hotel chain competing in the “semi-boutique” market.   The motif is an attempt at the 19th century European look. It comes off ok. The bed was comfortable. There is a free breakfast which includes hot egg dishes cooked to order. There is also something of a happy hour at which jug wine and canned beer is set out along with cheese and crackers. The main thing that I didn’t like was the air conditioning. The fan was so loud that I had to turn if off to talk on my cell phone but I had to leave it on most of the time since it was impossible to sleep with it cycling on and off. The room was somewhat

My brother was getting married at a private home in Laguna Hills, and the Ayres Hotel was one of the closest places for a lot of the family to stay. They gave us a good "wedding rate" and agreed to set aside 19 rooms. When we checked in, we were all pleasantly surprised at how lovely a facility it is. Check in was quick, and our room was beautiful. The room comes with a mini-kitchen, including fridge, microwave, coffeemaker,and sink. The king bed was luxurious and comfy. Everything was really clean, neat, and updated. We didn't have time to check out the pool or much of the grounds, but heard this was very nice. In the morning, the complimentary breakfast was great! A Belgian waffle- making station, fresh fruit, omlette station, bacon, sausage, pastries, bagels, etc. So the

Summary Heading: Ayres is friendly and elegant, with many free extras
Summary: This is a wonderful, friendly hotel.  I have stayed here many times.  While it sounds like one (and only one, by the way) of the writers had a bad experience, I do not believe that is at all representative of the property.    The Ayres Laguna Woods is both elegant and casual at the same time, and very warm.  The same staff has been there for years (which says a lot), and will really go out of their way for you.  The rooms are lovely, and spotlessly clean.  My room has always included a free microwave, fridge, and "bar" sink.  The rooms are very comfortable.  The hotel has a surprising number of free amenities, beginning with an extremely nice hot  and cold breakfast buffet (maybe they were winding down at 9:45 for MJS, but the preceding 3 hours I'm sure it was great, as it has

I stay at this hotel about 30-40 times a year as I do business in Irvine. The hotel has a great location. It is only a few miles from the Irvine Spectrum and Lauguna Beach. There is a grocery store across the street. The breakfast buffet includes made to order egg dishes along with sausage, bacon, & potatoes.  The rooms have plenty of space to work/relax. they have a fridge and microwave in every room. Some rooms have baths with waterjets.

I wasn't sure what to expect from this hotel but my husband and I were very happy with our stay at this jewel of a hotel.  The lobby was beautifully decorated for the holidays and check-in was a breeze.  This hotel didn't skimp on quality furniture and wall decor.  Our room was spacious - king size bed, desk, sofa & coffee table, wet bar, refrigerator and even a microwave!  Free ample parking and American style breakfast for hotel guests, not some cheapy continental breakfast some cheap hotels serve.  It  had a real family feel to the whole place, not some chain hotel that has cookie cutter look to everything.  Over all, I enjoyed this hotel and would recommend it to my friends.  My husband commented that this is better than some of nicer hotels we've visited that cost double

We had a very nice weekend stay at the Ayres Hotel while visiting relatives in Laguna Woods.  This hotel was much better than I had anticipated.  The location was great:  very convenient for shopping and a 15 minute drive to the beach at Laguna.  The rooms were surprisingly large and well equipped.  The bed was extremely comfortable.  I thought the hotel had a number of nice touches and the decor (nice carpets, drapes, upholstery) softened the basic structure of the place.  The pool area was particularly nice and the exterior (particularly at night) looked like an Italian villa.  I'd definitely stay at the Ayres again.
I stayed in the Ayres several times while on business trip in the area - it has always been a good choice. Staff is very friendly, rooms are well sized and very clean.

Summary Heading: Quirky Deco, but more than adequate
Summary: This hotel had a strange slant in the decor, and prided itself as a family run set of hotels. Staff friendly, helpful, and provided local maps of the area, and recommended restaurants. Decor is a mixture of Tuscan (exterior), English (seats), American (20th century replicas) - and always intrigues me in having a gas fire on, in the reception area whilst in the heat in California!  There is no bar in the hotel, and hence no real meeting place in the hotel - probably a frequent request of other travellers - unsure whether this is due to the family rules, or that the hotel is located in a senior residential area. There was a restaurant that provided breakfast, which was included in the price. Breakfast was well organised, plenty of choice from coffees, juices, through to a limited

I was traveling with my wife and two daughters aged 4 and 11 months.  We had requested a room with 2 queen beds but were put into a king when we arrived.  I called down to the desk and asked to be switched, after a 30 min wait we were finally given another room which was located directly above the meeting room.  That night there was a party in the meeting room that was so loud we could hardly hear the TV.  The party went well past 11pm and when I called down to see if anything could be done abot the noise I was told flat out NO!  We finally got the kids to bed around 1am.  The next morning we showed up for breakfast at 9:45 and was immediatly told by the cook that they were closing in 15 min and we could not get any new eggs.  The eggs on the buffet we old and hard.  The buffet

This is the hotel of choice for business travellers working at the many Irvine area businesses - and for good reason.   The rooms actually have decent lighting (rare in any hotel), comfortable beds, nice amenities, and a very, very good breakfast bar.  Evenings there is a wine & cheese which is a nice gesture.  Front desk staff are very helpful and friendly. Free parking, which is also rare for area hotels.  I would forfeit the Hilton & Sheraton points to stay at this hotel again!

This hotel is perfect.  The service, the ammenities, the fresh linens, the jacuzzi tub, the pool towel service....EVERYTHING is amazing.   They have a great breakfast buffet with incredible waffles.    I can not wait to stay again.  Love the ayres.

This is the second time we have stayed at this location and I feel remise that I did not give a review as this is a small gem.  We have friends that live in the Alsio Viejo area and we visit once a year from the southeast.  It's location is a little querky as it is in a strip mall right off of a main road but its predicability ends there.  Its traditionally quaint elegantly appointed rooms are soothing and warm.  The front staff are always dressed with ties and jackets.  Newspapers are available in the lobby.  The breakfast is wonderful - from make your own waffles, cereals, abundant fresh and cut fruit, muffins, rolls, toast, bagels and then freshy made omelets, bacon, sausage and potatoes.  Four different types of juice and coffee and teas are available.  There is plenty of

We stayed at this hotel because of the good reviews we read here and we could not have been happier. The room was beautiful, the bed was so comfortable. We stayed on the 3rd floor in room 329 and had a great view of the pool area and distance mountains. The breakfast was really tasty. They had several juices, toasts, pastries, make your own belgium waffles with strawberries and whip cream Yum! they also had made to order omelets and scrambled eggs, breakfast potatoes, sausage links and bacon.  I HIGHLY recommend this hotel. It's in a really great area. Only 5 min. from the Irvine Spectrum outdoor mall. This mall is new and fantastic.

This hotel was a very nice hotel for the cost (around 110/night group rate).  The lobby is very rich in fabrics, fireplace, and large over sized furniture.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  We were there for a wedding and they helped us in finding all of the events.  The breafast was good, but a bit chaotic on the cooks part.  It's great for a free breakfast, since they make omlettes to order. The outside patio is nice when it isn't raining.  The hotel is located in the same parking lot as some other stores, so you can easily walk to a few shops.  There was a sink and LARGE mirror in the bedroom (in addition to the sink and mirror that was part of the bathroom).  It came in handy but seemed very out of place.  The views out of the rooms could have been better.  For such a

Summary Heading: WOW, Better than we could asked for!
Summary: Fabulous Hotel, Top notch in everyway! Stayed 4 nights and loved every minute. Rooms beautifly appointed, staff excellent, wonderful breakfast included every morning.

Wasn't expecting much considering the $109/night group rate we got, but this was a very nice hotel.  Really comfy, king-size bed and high quality fixtures.  Micro and refrig in the room.  Very nicely decorated.  Overhead fan.  Didn't use the phone or internet, but no hidden add-on fees.  Just an approximately $11/night occupancy tax which I assume they have no control over.  Full, made-to-order breakfast which can be eaten outside on the patio.  Nice pool and spa.  Don't try to sneak pets in or smoke - they make you sign something that says it'll cost $150 if you get busted.  Everyone was friendly.  About 10 minutes to the little artsy community.

We arrived at the hotel and were so pleasantly surprised that the staff was able to check us in at 11 am.  We had a very disappointing stay the night prior in Santa Ana.  This hotel is immaculate, staff is so professional and friendly and goes the extra mile.  The rooms are in European decor and the mattress is very comfortable. Although this hotel is not quite in the center of Orange County, it is well worth the drive. Pool area and jaccuzi is quite nice as well. The 5pm cookies are a nice touch and the full cooked to order breakfast was great as well. There is no small, personal hotel like this in the area. You will not be disappointed. All this for a very reasonable price too.  Stay here!!!!!!!  A true gem.

OK this is a little late Since I stayed here in 9/02 but the memories are still fresh.I got a killer deal (69.00 per night) through my entertainment card. The room was fabulous. Small but appointed with beautiful linens and nice furniture. It was clean and had 4 star quality. The lobby was nicely done.We had a great breakfast for free.  The breakfast area is so different from the rooms and lobby. It is more like a cafeteria but it was nice.I can say that the room was so beautiful my wife and I took pictures of it. A really nice place for a great deal

We stayed at the Ayres Laguna Hills for few nights. This is one of those Hotels you fall in love with. When we checked in, the frontdesk person was very friendly and helped us check in. When we open the door to our room, we felt like we were in some musuem exhibit. The beds were so comfortable and clean. The hallway had alot of beautiful paintings. The pool area was in a Tuscany surroundings. The rate came with free full-breakfast and wine and cookies in the afternoon. I highly recommand this hotel.

Our family stayed at the Ayres hotel in Laguna Woods a few weeks ago.  I was pleasantly surprised.  The price was very reasonable.  The hotel was charming. The lobby and hallways were large, well-lit and decorated with beautiful art works.  The staff was courteous and very helpful.  The room was spacious and clean.  The beds were comfortable.  The breakfast served in the Chianti room was terrific.  What more can you ask?  I wish there are Ayres hotels in every state!
